review_blob: Pours a slightly cloudy goldenrod..hehe.  MInimal lacing with a nice staying foam.  Smells like its going to taste great. Subtle pine, citrus and fair smell of alcohol.Drinks with flavors of caramel coated grapefruit and a bitter flavor to overcome the alcohol.  Overall a pretty nice but potent brew. More enjoyable then  then the 99+ ibu IPAs.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: My favorite german beer without a doubt.  I prefer American Wheat to German Hefe & Weisse beers...but I absolutely love this beer.  I have yet to have a Weizen Bock that is better.   You will love the mixture of wheat and caramel/scotch malt flavors mixed with chocolatey prune boldness.  Just amazing...try one today!

Another quality session IPA.  The lowest ABV of any IPA I would buy for regular consumption.  Tasty..but could be improved upon a little bit.  A brand new batch was just made. Im with the guy who thinks Chinook...I love the grapefruit taste in this beer.  Mad Anthony India Pale Ale is 100% Chinook so that might explain why I like Barley quite well.  Ill ask Mike at Barley and report back with reviews on their full line.

So this beer somehow manages to blur the lines of two categories of beer I love...and does it oh so amazingly.  The yeast is in there as well as a nice hop profile. Much more interesting then most european hop oriented beers.  Truly one of my all time favorites.  I will be drinking it till there is no more.

I would say this beer sets the standard for what an imperial stout should be...then make it interesting.  Oak aged Yeti was a little more interesting but if they were both aged..I dont know which one I would like more.  Currently in my top two Imperial Stouts.  I loved it.

A near perfect stout for me.  Deep darkness in a glass.  An amazingly rich aroma of oak, vanilla, subtle coffee/chocolate and a tinge of fire!  This is my favorite stout of the year so far.  I like it only a tad bit better then Expedition Stout by Bells.  But this is amazing!
beer_name: Great Divide Yeti Imperial Stout - Oak Aged

review_blob: Doesnt look or smell like anything amazing.  Surprisingly unique taste but do to low ABV and much carbonation this brew doesnt do quite enough for me.   For something like this that is amazing....Try Mad Anthony India Pale Ale.  You will love it. 100 % Chinook Hops.

A well balanced tasty dark german brew.  prunes/raisins, caramel, scotch and chocolate all available here.  Not an every day drinker so not a favorite for me...but defenitely something delicious I will come back to.

For me this is a near perfect beer.  The hops taste as fresh as any Ive had.  Being a hop lover Ive been very into the harvest ales this year.  I tried Sierra Nevada, Founders and Three Floyds Broodoo....all fresh hop ales.  Each one is unique.  I would try the Sierra Nevada Harvest first..then the other two.  Broodoo was amazing and Founders was pretty awesome.
One of the most consistent IPAs.  Well balanced like the Stone IPA but more interesting.  A wonderful floral aroma.  Very drinkable.

The 2nd most underrated IPA Ive tried.   Almost all the India Pale Ales I love are between 6.5-7 %. This is the perfect session beer for me.  The most toned down among my favorite IPAs but unique enough to drink regularly.  I sincerely love this beer.

This is the most underrated IPA on the market.   I buy, sell and try beer every week.  I just had a IPA tasting at my house with 11 IPAs last night and this one came in  3rd place overall.  I placed it in 2nd with Founders Harvest at #1 and Bells Two Hearted at # 3. The tasting included Harvest Ale, Two Hearted, MA IPA, Lakefront, Victory, Stone, Boulder Beer, Great Divide, Dogfish Head, Great Lakes and Barley Island.  Message me for the full results of our Hop Off!

Just had a IPA tasting last night at my house.  There was no hype involved..just plenty of IPAs to go around.  This one got in dead last out of 11 brews.  Ratings arent always correct because people are easily influenced by others opinion.  Seriously overrated beer.  IPAs are my favorite.
Received a free bottle today.  Thankful but disappointed.  I thought this beer was boring so no detail necessary.  Preferred the Asam Bock I just had.

Smells like prunes and caramel.  Looks roasty brown with upper 2/3s of glass too dark to see through.  A well disguised wallop.  A deep but roasty and dry flavor. Almost taste like a fuller bodied nut-brown.  Not a favorite but decent. Just recently had something similar I liked better.

I loved this beer.  Just got one in the new bottles.  Its actually called Beastie Barrel Stout but its right up there with Expedition for me.  Obviously different ..but one of my favorite stouts Ive ever had.  An absolute must try...amazing!!!

An IPA staple for a good reason.  Unmistakable.  Light Amber in color and just make me think it would be the best sea fairing bear for the summer.  Plenty of hops and the right kinds for me.   Maybe Simcoe/Cascade and I dont know what else.  I know its 3 kinds though.  Grapefruit, Orange and a slight citrus tinge is in their.

Full of Malts, caramel, some roasted coffee and a little bit chocolate. Creamy but not that syrup crap many Stout makers are passing off.  Absolutely delicous.  Just sampled a fresh batch from Oct. 08.  It think its even better this year...

smooth malt, oats and a bit of coffee.  But for me the alcohol was not disguised well enough.  A little heavy for me.  I liked the Silk Porter better...I didnt like this one nearly as much as everyone else apparently.

Extreme chocolate!  Definitely not an every day drinker...but I do think it was fairly interesting.  That being said Ive had several better stouts.  The kind of beer Ill have every couple of years.  Peace!
Somewhat sweet and malty.  Deep black.  Im definitely tasting some licorice.  A decent smell but Ive had more interesting Porters.
